name: Coconut Mashed Yams With Currants
description: These easy, butter-free, dairy-free mashed yams from Chloe Coscarelli, the vegan cookbook author, are gussied up with creamy coconut milk, maple syrup and warm autumn spices.
keywords: coconut milk, currants, yams, dairy-free, gluten-free, kosher, nut-free, vegan, vegetarian, fall, winter, side dish
recipeIngredient: 3 large garnet or other yams, peeled and cut into 2-inch pieces
1 cup canned coconut milk, mixed well before measuring
1/3 cup maple syrup or packed brown sugar
1/3 cup currants, soaked in warm water for 10 to 15 minutes and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Place yam pieces in a large pot and cover with cold water. Cover and bring to a boil. Cook until fork-tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain and return to pot.

Add coconut milk, maple syrup, salt and spices, and mash with a potato masher until smooth. Adjust seasoning to taste. Add more coconut milk for a creamier texture and more maple syrup for a sweeter flavor. Mix in currants and serve.
